intro: Rubus gracilior, commonly known as slender blackberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, dark purple to black berries. The plant features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces white to pale pink flowers in the spring. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. The berries are edible but have a tart flavor and are sometimes used in jams and wines.
